asset.description: An item or resource of value that is owned or controlled.

asset/coin.description: A digital or physical currency used as a medium of exchange, including cryptocurrencies

asset/collection.description: A curated group of related assets organized under a common theme or purpose

asset/data.description: A digital representation of data, such as financial data, scientific data, or other types of data that can be stored and shared in a decentralized manner

asset/device.description: A physical or virtual tool or equipment used to perform specific tasks or functions

asset/impactCredit.description: A unit representing verified environmental or social impact, such as carbon sequestration or community development outcomes

asset/learnership.description: An asset representing a structured learning program that combines theoretical study with practical workplace experience

asset/membershipAsset.description: An asset signifying membership rights or privileges within a group, organization, or service

dao.description: A Decentralized Autonomous Organization operating through smart contracts.

deed.description: A legal document representing ownership or an agreement.

deed/offer.description: A deed representing a formal expression of willingness to provide or do something

deed/proposal.description: A deed that outlines a suggested plan or action for consideration and approval

deed/request.description: A deed detailing an appeal or demand for something to be provided or done

deed/subscription.description: A deed that signifies an agreement to receive or support something regularly, such as a service or membership

group.description: An aggregation of individuals or entities with a common purpose.

group/categorical.description: A group where governance rights and decision-making power are distributed among members based on their participation and contributions

group/multiSignatureGovernance.description: A group governed by multiple signature holders who must reach consensus for executing transactions and making organizational decisions

group/nativeTokenStaking.description: A group where participants stake native tokens to gain voting rights and participate in governance, often receiving rewards for their stake

group/nftStaking.description: A group where NFT holders can stake their tokens to participate in governance and receive benefits, combining digital asset ownership with decision-making rights

investment.description: An allocation of resources, typically capital, in expectation of a future return.

oracle.description: A service providing external data to smart contracts or blockchain systems.

oracle/participationOfPeople.description: Involves human oversight in decision-making processes

oracle/pathfinding.description: Guides users through complex decision-making processes

oracle/patternRecognition.description: Identifies patterns in data to inform decision-making and optimize strategies

oracle/payment.description: Automates payments based on impact goal achievements, using smart contracts to streamline transactions

oracle/performanceMonitoring.description: Tracks project performance in real-time, providing feedback and analytics

oracle/personalization.description: Tailors interactions and recommendations to individual users, enhancing user experience

oracle/planning.description: Supports strategic planning by predicting trends and resource needs

oracle/policyEnforcement.description: Ensures compliance with policies and regulations, enforcing rules automatically

oracle/portfolioManagement.description: Manages and optimizes project portfolios for strategic goals

oracle/positioning.description: Determines optimal placement of resources and interventions within the ecosystem

oracle/prescribingInterventions.description: Recommends actions based on data analysis to guide stakeholders towards effective strategies

oracle/preventionOfRisks.description: Anticipates and mitigates potential risks to keep projects on track

oracle/privacyProtection.description: Safeguards sensitive information and ensures compliance with regulations

oracle/problemDetectionAndResolution.description: Monitors systems for potential issues, enabling early detection and resolution

oracle/processOptimization.description: Enhances operational efficiency by automating tasks and streamlining workflows

oracle/profiling.description: Creates detailed profiles of users and projects for accurate targeting of interventions

oracle/proofing.description: Ensures data integrity and authenticity, validating claims and outcomes for transparent impact reporting

oracle/protocolAdherence.description: Ensures compliance with predefined protocols for consistency and reliability

project.description: A planned undertaking or initiative to achieve specific goals.

protocol.description: A system of rules or procedures for transmitting data or interacting with systems.

protocol/verifiableClaim.description: A protocol for creating verifiable claims and defining the claims content and structure

protocol/verifiableCredential.description: A protocol for creating verifiable credentials and defining the credentials content and structure

protocol/task.description: A protocol defining the structure, execution, and verification of specific tasks or activities

protocol/asset.description: A protocol governing the creation of digital assets and defining the assets properties

protocol/dao.description: A protocol establishing the governance, operation, and decision-making processes of decentralized autonomous organizations

protocol/deed.description: A protocol for creating deeds and defining the deeds content and structure

protocol/group.description: A protocol for creating groups and defining the formation, membership, and governance structures

protocol/investment.description: A protocol governing investment processes, including funding, returns, and impact measurement

protocol/oracle.description: A protocol for creating oracles and defining the oracles properties

protocol/project.description: A protocol for creating project domains and defining the domains properties
